imdb.title: Hibike! Euphonium
imdb.plot: Kumiko, a girl with absolutely no ambition, decides to change herself now that she has started her high school life and try to leave her hobby, playing euphonium in orchestra aside but she totally cannot forget it anyway.

episodes.title: Mid-summer Fanfare
episodes.plot: As the Kitauji wind band celebrates moving on to regionals, Kumiko notices an unfamiliar girl their age leaving the concert hall. Later, Kumiko joins Reina taking part in early-morning practice sessions in addition to usual club meetings.

episodes.title: Hesitation Flute
episodes.plot: The band members take a break at the pool before embarking on a training camp.

episodes.title: Troubled Nocturnes
episodes.plot: The band settles into a Spartan rehearsal schedule as the camp continues. Taki approves Kumiko to play the part she had trouble with in the previous concert with Asuka, but Mizore's oboe solo is criticized by Hashimoto, who encourages her to show more emotion.

episodes.title: Awakening Oboe
episodes.plot: With the training camp over, Nozomi comes to thank Kumiko for her efforts and then decides to visit the clubroom and say hello to Mizore.

episodes.title: Miraculous Harmony
episodes.plot: Kitauji prepares for the Kansai regionals.

episodes.title: Rainy Conductor
episodes.plot: The Kitauji band plays a piece in the school's cultural festival together with the members who did not make the auditions.

episodes.title: Station Concert
episodes.plot: Taki arranges for the band to play in a concert at the train station.

episodes.title: Rhapsody in Flu
episodes.plot: Kumiko reflects on her sister, who was her original inspiration for wanting to play music, and the way her sister quit band to focus on college exams.

episodes.title: Sound! Euphonium
episodes.plot: Various band members pressure Kumiko to do something about Asuka's home situation.

episodes.title: After School Obligato
episodes.plot: After she returns from Asuka's house, Kumiko and her sister reconcile while making dinner. Knowing how much her sister regretted letting their parents push her around, Kumiko appeals to Asuka after school to stay in band, mentioning that everyone wants her to stay.

episodes.title: First Love Trumpet
episodes.plot: Kumiko unsuccessfully tries to corner Reina with help from Hazuki and Sapphire, only for Reina to ask her to climb Mt. Tenran again.

episodes.title: The Last Competition
episodes.plot: The band travels to nationals to play their final concert.

episodes.title: Early-Spring Epilogue
episodes.plot: The third year students retire from the club after the competition.

episodes.title: Welcome to High School
episodes.plot: Kumiko enters Kitauji High School having been unable to forget what Reina said at a middle school concert band competition. She goes to visit the concert band at school along with classmates Hazuki and Sapphire, where they meet Reina again.

episodes.title: Nice to Meet You, Euphonium
episodes.plot: Kumiko and the others join the concert band, and they choose their instruments. Their eccentric senior, Asuka, still likes to mess with them.

episodes.title: The First Ensemble
episodes.plot: Kitauji High School Concert Band is preparing their parts for the ensemble, but some students are fooling around when they should be practicing.

episodes.title: Singing Solfege
episodes.plot: Despite still having reservations about Mr. Taki, the club decides to practice for their second ensemble. Mr. Taki engages the club in a variety of drills: having them run around the school and play their instruments, engaging the students in breathing exercises, and finally working with each section individually.

episodes.title: Festival Time
episodes.plot: The band prepares for its upcoming performance at SunFes as uniforms are handed out and the students are drilled on how to march in unison.

episodes.title: Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Tuba
episodes.plot: Starting this year, the band holds auditions for members participating in the competition. First-year Hazuki has a chance, too. The bass section does everything they can to encourage her.

episodes.title: Crybaby Saxophone
episodes.plot: The band is hard at work preparing for the audition and the competition. Aoi has trouble with her part, to which Taki says, "when will you be better by?"

episodes.title: Festive Triangle
episodes.plot: On their way home from school, Shuichi asks a shocked Kumiko to go to the Agata Festival with him, to which she does not reply.

episodes.title: Please Audition
episodes.plot: Midori feels guilt over having pushed Hazuki into confessing, blaming herself for her friend's rejection. Asuka criticizes the noticeable drop in Midori's performance during practice, and declares bluntly that she has no interest in personal matters unrelated to band.

episodes.title: Straight-Ahead Trumpet
episodes.plot: Upon discovering that Mr. Taki had known Reina prior to their meeting at Kitauji, Yuko publicly accuses him of playing favorites in the auditions.

episodes.title: Welcome Home Audition
episodes.plot: After hearing Reina practice for the audition, Yuko is shocked at her playing ability, privately conceding to Kumiko that Reina is fit to play the solo. Meanwhile, Kaori attempts to gauge Asuka's opinion regarding her playing.

episodes.title: My Euphonium
episodes.plot: Mr. Taki asks the euphoniums to play an additional section. While Asuka is quick to learn the part, Kumiko finds herself struggling to master the piece despite relentless practice.

episodes.title: Goodbye Competition
episodes.plot: The competition performance is "only" 12 minutes long. It's both a blink of an eye and an eternity. The Concert Band members bet their entire youths on this competition. And Kitauji High School Concert Band's performance begins.

episodes.title: Ready, Set, Monaka
episodes.plot: An extra story focusing on the band mates that didn't make competition.
